## validLadybugMoves() function

> This API is provided as a beta preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Get all valid moves for the tile at the given coordinate acting as a ladybug.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function validLadybugMoves(board: GameBoard, coordinate: HexCoordinate): HexCoordinate[];
```

</td><td>

A game board.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

</td><td>

[HexCoordinate](./hive-lib.hexcoordinate.md)


</td><td>

The location of the tile acting as a ladybug.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[HexCoordinate](./hive-lib.hexcoordinate.md)<!-- -->\[\]

An array of hex coordinates.

## Remarks

The ladybug rules state that the ladybug moves three spaces; two on top of the hive, then one down. It must move exactly two on top of the hive and then move one down on its last move. It may not move around the outside of the hive and may not end its movement on top of the hive.
